specific_issues.description:
(1) Issues related to the proposed termination/consolidation of federal science, technology, engineering, and mathematics education programs that are currently offered by a variety of federal agencies, including the National Aeronautics and Space Administration's (NASA's) Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities.
(2) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; funding for NASA's Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities; funding for educational offerings within NASA's Science Mission Directorate.
(3) Submitted outside witness testimony before the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies regarding FY 2017 funding for NASA's Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities.
(4) Submitted outside witness testimony before the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies regarding FY 2017 funding for NASA's Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities.
(5) Sponsorship of/participation in Museums Advocacy Day 2016.

ali_info.federal_agencies: U.S. SENATE, U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES

specific_issues.description:
(1) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; funding for the Institute of Museum and Library Services; funding for the Office of Museum Services; funding for competitive grant programs for which science centers and museums are eligible to apply.
(2) Sponsorship of/participation in Museums Advocacy Day 2016.

ali_info.federal_agencies: U.S. SENATE, U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES

specific_issues.description:
(1) Issues related to the proposed termination/consolidation of federal science, technology, engineering, mathematics, health, and environmental education programs that are currently offered by a variety of federal agencies.
(2) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA); Education Directorate; funding for the Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities; Science Mission Directorate; funding for education-related offerings.
(3) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; National Science Foundation (NSF); Directorate for Education and Human Resources; funding for the Advancing Informal STEM Learning program.
(4) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA); Office of Education; funding for the Bay-Watershed Education and Training Regional Programs and the Competitive Education Grant program/Environmental Literacy Grant program.
(5) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; Institute of Museum and Library Services; Office of Museum Services; funding for competitive grant programs for which science centers and museums are eligible to apply.
(6) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; Department of Education; funding for the 21st Century Community Learning Centers program.
(7) Bill numbers pending; FY 2017 Labor, Health and Human Services, Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Bill; National Institutes of Health; Office of the Director; funding for the Science Education Partnership Award program.
(8) Submitted outside witness testimony before the House Appropriations Subcommittee on Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies regarding FY 2017 funding for NASA's Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities; NOAA's Bay-Watershed Education and Training Regional Programs and the Competitive Education Grant program/Environmental Literacy Grant program; and NSF's Advancing Informal STEM Learning program.
(9) Submitted outside witness testimony before the Senate Appropriations Subcommittee on Commerce, Justice, Science, and Related Agencies regarding FY 2017 funding for NASA's Competitive Program for Science Museums, Planetariums, and NASA Visitor Centers Plus Other Opportunities.
(10) Sponsorship of/participation in Museums Advocacy Day 2016.
